Only three tams:perf imperf gen;irregular pattern class,cf pp. 267f
There are 12 pref verbs (Hayward1984a p. 261). A complete list is given in the infinitive paradigm.

prop.val: alt. in 1 sg and imprtv aff
1 sg ʔElɗ-, other sg ʔELL-, all pl ḳeʔ-. Causative:ʔIssIl-
Irregular Imperative:sg may pl maaččá. Subj t- n- optionally palatalized

pdgm.pdgmnote: Only three tams:perf imperf gen;irregular pattern class,cf ... 267f
Only three tams:perf imperf gen;neg general is invariant (pp. 316f)
Note E harmony (a - goes_to e) in pattern1 imperf (Haywood1984a 265f)
Note also referfence to “26 sufix verbs showing some sort of irregularity” and noted in the lexicon. (Hayward1984a p. 298)

prop.val: suppletive has full pdgm as ‘look at’
lex has full pdgm with meaning ‘go to’
suppletive has full pdgm as ‘be finished, exhausted’
suppletive has full pdgm as ‘run away’

pdgm.pdgmnote: “The extended stem passive verbs are vary rare indeed in Arbore” (Hayward1984a p. 304). Place is taken by Impersonal Construction (= 3 pl verb form in sentence with –na enclitic,pp. 304-308).
Note E harmony (a - goes_to e) in pattern1 imperf (Haywood1984a 265f)
Note E harmony (a - goes_to e) in pattern1 imperf (Haywood1984a 265f)

There is a –úm infinitive (token 1) and a –mé infinitive (shape2). The former is the default,and the only one possible with prefix verbs (form is based on 3 m sg). Most,but not all,suffix verbs can take a –mé infinitive.
Note E harmony (a - goes_to e) in pattern1 imperf (Haywood1984a 265f)

“With the exception of sg imprtv of most verbs all verb forms terminate in a vowel.” (pref and suff largely identical) Hayward1984b p. 255

prop.val: in free variation with –e for mid1/2/3/4
